title: Ryan Murphy to produce A Chorus Line miniseries for Netflix.
text:
Photo: Paul Archuleta/FilmMagic

Ryan Murphy revealed in a Time profile that he will be producing A Chorus Line miniseries, an Andy Warhol series, and an original series starring Patti LuPone for Netflix, as part of a multi-year deal with the streaming giant, because, apparently, this man does not sleep. He is also working on a Marlene Dietrich project with Jessica Lange, though it is unclear if this will be a movie or a series. Murphy, who previously produced shows exclusively for Fox, signed his deal with Netflix in early 2018. He, of course, already produces Pose, American Horror Story, American Crime Story, 911 and 911: Lone Star, as well as Netflix’s Ratched and The Politician. It’s only a matter of time before the man runs out of queer icons to write biopics about. Somewhere, Murphy sits ram-rod straight up in bed and whispers, “George Michael miniseries.”
description: Ryan Murphy to produce tv series and films for Netflix, including A Chorus Line, Jessica Lange project, and Andy Warhol miniseries.
